text: Sir John Soane (10 September 1753 â€“ 20 January 1837) was an English architect. He was knighted in 1831. He was the greatest architect of his day. His house in Lincoln's Inn Fields is now Sir John Soane's Museum and is open to the public. On 15 November 1821 Soane was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society. == References == Category:English architects Category:1753 births Category:1837 deaths Category:Fellows of the Royal Society Category:Knights Bachelor Category:People from Reading, Berkshire
title: John Soane
